questions.question: Why did the Harappan Civilization get its name?

options.text: It was mentioned in ancient texts

questions.answer: Excavations first began at Harappa

questions.question: On the banks of which river was Harappa located?
questions.answer: Ravi

questions.question: Which site is located about 650 km south of Harappa in the Indus valley?
questions.answer: Mohen-jo-daro

questions.question: What was observed between Harappa and Mohen-jo-daro remains?
questions.answer: Striking resemblance

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a Harappan site?
questions.answer: Pataliputra

questions.question: Which feature was common across Harappan cities?
questions.answer: Planned town layout

questions.question: Which material was mainly used to construct Harappan houses?
questions.answer: Baked bricks

questions.question: What feature indicates concern for public health in Harappan cities?
questions.answer: Covered drainage system

questions.question: How were Harappan streets laid out?
questions.answer: Grid pattern

questions.question: What divided Harappan towns into different sections?
questions.answer: Fortifications

questions.question: Harappan seals were mainly made from which stone?
questions.answer: Steatite

questions.question: What was the primary use of Harappan seals?
questions.answer: Stamps

questions.question: Which imaginary animal appears on Harappan seals?
questions.answer: Unicorn

questions.question: Which colour patterns were common on Harappan pots?
questions.answer: Black on red

questions.question: Which design was NOT mentioned on Harappan pottery?
questions.answer: Lotus petals

questions.question: What was buried along with the dead in Harappan burials?
questions.answer: Earthen pots

questions.question: Where was the Great Bath discovered?
questions.answer: Mohen-jo-daro

questions.question: Which feature prevented water seepage in the Great Bath?
questions.answer: Baked bricks

questions.question: Which evidence shows Harappans practised agriculture?
questions.answer: Ploughed field at Kalibangan

questions.question: Which crops were mainly grown by the Harappans?
questions.answer: Wheat and barley

questions.question: Which crop was grown extensively in Gujarat?
questions.answer: Ragi

questions.question: Which fibre were Harappans familiar with?
questions.answer: Cotton

questions.question: Which clothing style was common among Harappans?
questions.answer: Knee-length cloth with upper garment

questions.question: Which materials were used to make Harappan ornaments?
questions.answer: Gold, copper, stones and shells

questions.question: Which ornament was worn by women up to the upper arm?
questions.answer: Bangles

questions.question: Which feature highlights Harappan artistic skill?
questions.answer: Detailed statues

questions.question: Which pattern is seen on the statueâ€™s cloak?
questions.answer: Trefoil

questions.question: Which region was famous for Harappan cotton?
questions.answer: Indus Valley

questions.question: To which region did Harappans export muslin cloth?
questions.answer: Egypt

questions.question: Which items were imported by the Harappans?
questions.answer: Silver and gemstones

questions.question: Which site had a dockyard indicating maritime trade?
questions.answer: Lothal

questions.question: Which evidence suggests sea trade by Harappans?
questions.answer: Seals with ship images

questions.question: Along which sea was Harappan coastal trade carried out?
questions.answer: Arabian Sea

questions.question: Which factor was NOT a reason for Harappan decline?
questions.answer: Rise in trade

questions.question: Which climatic factor affected Harappan regions?
questions.answer: Weakening monsoon

questions.question: What happened to people after environmental changes?
questions.answer: They migrated to other places

questions.question: What type of civilization was Harappan Civilization?
questions.answer: Urban

questions.question: Which feature best reflects Harappan civic planning?
questions.answer: Drainage system

questions.question: Which item reflects Harappan recreational life?
questions.answer: Toys

questions.question: Which practice shows Harappan respect for the dead?
questions.answer: Burial with pots

questions.question: Which field evidence proves use of plough?
questions.answer: Kalibangan

questions.question: Which item shows Harappans were skilled weavers?
questions.answer: Cloth remains

questions.question: Which export strengthened Harappan trade relations?
questions.answer: Cotton cloth

questions.question: Which factor shows Harappan engineering skill?
questions.answer: Great Bath construction

questions.question: What was the depth of the Great Bath?
questions.answer: 2.5 metres

questions.question: Which system existed for maintaining the Great Bath?
questions.answer: Provision for draining and refilling

questions.question: Which region supplied deodar wood?
questions.answer: Kashmir

questions.question: Which evidence proves long-distance trade?
questions.answer: Imported metals and gems

questions.question: What weakened trade in the later Harappan period?
questions.answer: Environmental changes

questions.question: What legacy did the Harappan Civilization leave?
questions.answer: Foundation of Indian civilization

questions.question: Why is the Harappan Civilization also called the Indus Civilization?
questions.answer: Because many Harappan sites were located in the Indus valley region.

questions.question: When did archaeological excavation first begin at Harappa?
questions.answer: Archaeological excavation first began at Harappa in 1921 CE.

questions.question: What similarity was observed between Harappa and Mohen-jo-daro?
questions.answer: A striking resemblance was observed in their structures and artefacts.

questions.question: Name any two important sites of the Harappan Civilization.
questions.answer: Dholavira and Lothal are important Harappan sites.

questions.question: Which construction material was mainly used in Harappan houses?
questions.answer: Baked bricks were mainly used in the construction of Harappan houses.

questions.question: What was the basic layout of Harappan houses?
questions.answer: Harappan houses were built around a central courtyard.

questions.question: Which facilities were commonly found inside Harappan houses?
questions.answer: Wells, bathrooms and toilets were commonly found in Harappan houses.

questions.question: What material was used for drainage conduits in Harappan cities?
questions.answer: Baked earthen conduits were used for drainage in Harappan cities.

questions.question: Why is the Harappan drainage system considered advanced?
questions.answer: Because the drains were covered and well-planned, showing concern for public health.

questions.question: How were streets planned in Harappan towns?
questions.answer: The streets were broad and laid out in a grid pattern.

questions.question: How were Harappan towns divided?
questions.answer: Harappan towns were divided into two or more sections with separate fortifications.

questions.question: What shape were most Harappan seals?
questions.answer: Most Harappan seals were square-shaped.

questions.question: Which stone was used to make Harappan seals?
questions.answer: Harappan seals were made from a stone called steatite.

questions.question: Name any two real animals depicted on Harappan seals.
questions.answer: Bulls and elephants are depicted on Harappan seals.

questions.question: Which imaginary animal is seen on Harappan seals?
questions.answer: The unicorn is the imaginary animal seen on Harappan seals.

questions.question: For what purpose were Harappan seals mainly used?
questions.answer: Harappan seals were mainly used as stamps.

questions.question: What type of pots were commonly used by the Harappans?
questions.answer: Red terracotta pots with black patterns were commonly used.

questions.question: Mention any one design found on Harappan pottery.
questions.answer: Fish scale patterns are found on Harappan pottery.

questions.question: What objects were buried with the dead in Harappan times?
questions.answer: Earthen pots were buried with the dead.

questions.question: Where was the Great Bath discovered?
questions.answer: The Great Bath was discovered at Mohen-jo-daro.

questions.question: How deep was the tank of the Great Bath?
questions.answer: The tank of the Great Bath was nearly 2.5 metres deep.

questions.question: What was used to prevent water seepage in the Great Bath?
questions.answer: Baked bricks were used to prevent water seepage.

questions.question: What arrangements existed for maintaining the Great Bath?
questions.answer: There were provisions for draining, cleaning and refilling the tank.

questions.question: Which evidence proves that Harappans practised agriculture?
questions.answer: A ploughed field discovered at Kalibangan proves Harappans practised agriculture.

questions.question: Name the main crops grown by the Harappans.
questions.answer: Wheat and barley were the main crops grown by the Harappans.

questions.question: Which crop was grown on a large scale in Rajasthan?
questions.answer: Barley was grown on a large scale in Rajasthan.

questions.question: Which crop was mainly grown in Gujarat during Harappan times?
questions.answer: Ragi was mainly grown in Gujarat.

questions.question: Which fibre were the Harappans familiar with?
questions.answer: The Harappans were familiar with cotton.

questions.question: What type of clothes did Harappan men and women wear?
questions.answer: They wore knee-length cloth with an upper garment.

questions.question: Name any two materials used to make Harappan ornaments.
questions.answer: Gold and precious stones were used to make ornaments.

questions.question: Which ornaments were commonly worn by Harappan women?
questions.answer: Women wore bangles up to their upper arms.

questions.question: What does the statue with a trefoil patterned cloak indicate?
questions.answer: It indicates the artistic skill of the Harappan people.

questions.question: Within which regions did the Harappans carry out trade?
questions.answer: They carried out trade within India and with foreign countries.

questions.question: Which product of the Indus Valley was famous in foreign trade?
questions.answer: High quality cotton was famous in foreign trade.

questions.question: Which cloth did Harappan traders supply to Egypt?
questions.answer: Harappan traders supplied muslin cloth to Egypt.

questions.question: Name any two items imported by the Harappans.
questions.answer: Silver and gemstones were imported by the Harappans.

questions.question: Which site provides evidence of Harappan sea trade?
questions.answer: Lothal provides evidence of Harappan sea trade.

questions.question: What structure at Lothal indicates maritime trade?
questions.answer: A huge dockyard at Lothal indicates maritime trade.

questions.question: Along which sea was Harappan trade carried out?
questions.answer: Harappan trade was carried out along the Arabian Sea.

questions.question: Name any one reason for the decline of the Harappan Civilization.
questions.answer: Frequent floods were one reason for the decline.

questions.question: How did weakening of the monsoon affect Harappan cities?
questions.answer: It led to arid conditions and drying up of river basins.

questions.question: What role did earthquakes play in the decline of Harappan cities?
questions.answer: Earthquakes damaged cities and contributed to their decline.

questions.question: Why did people migrate during the decline of the Harappan Civilization?
questions.answer: People migrated due to environmental changes and loss of resources.

questions.question: How is the Harappan Civilization described at its peak?
questions.answer: It is described as a prosperous and flourishing urban civilization.

questions.question: What type of civilization was the Harappan Civilization?
questions.answer: The Harappan Civilization was an urban civilization.

questions.question: Which aspect of Harappan cities shows concern for hygiene?
questions.answer: The well-planned covered drainage system shows concern for hygiene.

questions.question: Which feature reflects Harappan civic sense?
questions.answer: The systematic town planning reflects Harappan civic sense.

questions.question: What does uniform town planning suggest about Harappan society?
questions.answer: It suggests strong administrative planning and organization.

questions.question: Which activity shows Harappan technological advancement?
questions.answer: Construction of the Great Bath shows technological advancement.

questions.question: What foundation did the Harappan Civilization lay for India?
questions.answer: It laid the foundation of the Indian Civilization.

questions.question: Explain why the Harappan Civilization is regarded as a well-organized urban civilization.
questions.answer: It had planned towns, uniform construction, covered drainage systems and systematic layout of streets.

questions.question: How does town planning reflect administrative efficiency in Harappan cities?
questions.answer: Uniform grid patterns, standardized bricks and organized drainage indicate strong administrative control.

questions.question: Why is the drainage system considered one of the greatest achievements of the Harappans?
questions.answer: Because it was covered, well-maintained and designed with concern for public health.

questions.question: Explain the importance of the central courtyard in Harappan houses.
questions.answer: It provided ventilation, light and space for household activities.

questions.question: How do seals help historians understand Harappan society?
questions.answer: Seals reveal religious beliefs, animals, artistic skills and commercial practices.

questions.question: Why were seals made in uniform shapes and materials?
questions.answer: Uniformity suggests standardization for trade and administrative purposes.

questions.question: Explain the significance of animal figures on Harappan seals.
questions.answer: They indicate symbolic beliefs and familiarity with wildlife.

questions.question: Why is Harappan pottery important for studying daily life?
questions.answer: Pottery reveals food habits, artistic taste and burial customs.

questions.question: How does burial with pots reflect Harappan beliefs?
questions.answer: It suggests belief in life after death or respect for the deceased.

questions.question: Explain why the Great Bath is considered an engineering marvel.
questions.answer: Its waterproof construction, steps and drainage show advanced engineering skills.

questions.question: What does the Great Bath suggest about Harappan social practices?
questions.answer: It suggests collective or ceremonial bathing practices.

questions.question: Why was provision for cleaning and refilling important in the Great Bath?
questions.answer: It ensured hygiene and regular use of the structure.

questions.question: How does evidence from Kalibangan prove agricultural advancement?
questions.answer: The ploughed field shows knowledge of farming techniques.

questions.question: Why was agriculture the backbone of Harappan life?
questions.answer: It provided food security and supported urban settlements.

questions.question: Explain how crop diversity reflects regional adaptation in Harappan areas.
questions.answer: Different regions grew crops suited to local climate and soil.

questions.question: How does evidence of cotton use highlight Harappan innovation?
questions.answer: It shows early knowledge of fibre cultivation and textile production.

questions.question: Why are ornaments important for understanding Harappan culture?
questions.answer: They indicate social status, craftsmanship and aesthetic sense.

questions.question: Explain the significance of multistrand necklaces and bangles.
questions.answer: They show advanced jewellery-making skills and fashion sense.

questions.question: How does Harappan sculpture reflect artistic excellence?
questions.answer: Detailed facial features and patterned clothing show refined art.

questions.question: Why is the trefoil pattern important in Harappan art?
questions.answer: It reflects decorative sophistication and symbolic design.

questions.question: How did internal trade contribute to Harappan prosperity?
questions.answer: It enabled exchange of goods between regions and supported economy.

questions.question: Explain the importance of foreign trade in Harappan Civilization.
questions.answer: Foreign trade brought wealth and resources from distant regions.

questions.question: Why was cotton a major export of the Harappans?
questions.answer: Because the Indus Valley produced high-quality cotton.

questions.question: How does the dockyard at Lothal prove maritime trade?
questions.answer: Its structure shows planning for ships and sea-based trade.

questions.question: Why are seals with ship images significant?
questions.answer: They provide evidence of sea routes and maritime knowledge.

questions.question: Explain how imported goods reflect Harappan trade networks.
questions.answer: Imports show connections with distant regions like Iran and Afghanistan.

questions.question: How did environmental changes weaken Harappan cities?
questions.answer: They reduced water supply, agriculture and trade.

questions.question: Why did drying up of rivers affect Harappan settlements?
questions.answer: Settlements depended on rivers for water and farming.

questions.question: Explain the impact of weakening monsoon on Harappan life.
questions.answer: It caused arid conditions and crop failure.

questions.question: How did decline in trade contribute to the fall of the civilization?
questions.answer: Economic decline weakened cities and livelihoods.

questions.question: Why did people migrate during the decline of Harappan cities?
questions.answer: Due to loss of resources and environmental stress.

questions.question: Explain how natural disasters may have accelerated decline.
questions.answer: Floods and earthquakes damaged infrastructure and settlements.

questions.question: Why is the Harappan Civilization described as prosperous?
questions.answer: Because of advanced urban life, trade and agriculture.

questions.question: How does uniformity across sites reflect cultural unity?
questions.answer: Similar structures and artefacts show shared cultural practices.

questions.question: Why is Harappan Civilization considered a foundation of Indian civilization?
questions.answer: It introduced urban planning, trade and cultural traditions.

questions.question: Explain how Harappan achievements influenced later civilizations.
questions.answer: Later societies adopted agriculture, crafts and urban practices.

questions.question: Why is archaeological excavation essential for studying Harappans?
questions.answer: Because no written records are fully understood.

questions.question: How does material evidence compensate for lack of written records?
questions.answer: Artefacts and structures reveal lifestyle and technology.

questions.question: Explain the importance of studying Harappan sites on maps.
questions.answer: It helps understand geographical spread and trade routes.

questions.question: Why is Harappan Civilization called a planned civilization?
questions.answer: Because cities followed systematic layouts and standard designs.

questions.question: How does Harappan housing reflect social equality?
questions.answer: Houses were similar in design without extreme differences.

questions.question: Why are toys important for understanding Harappan life?
questions.answer: They show leisure activities and childhood culture.

questions.question: Explain how Harappan life was closely linked to environment.
questions.answer: Agriculture, trade and settlements depended on natural conditions.

questions.question: Why did Harappans prefer baked bricks over mud bricks?
questions.answer: Baked bricks were stronger and more durable.

questions.question: How does standard brick size indicate central control?
questions.answer: Standardization suggests regulation by authority.

questions.question: Why is Harappan Civilization studied as a single cultural unit?
questions.answer: Because of shared features across all sites.

questions.question: How does Harappan trade reflect economic planning?
questions.answer: Organized exports and imports show structured economy.

questions.question: Explain the role of rivers in Harappan prosperity.
questions.answer: Rivers supported agriculture, trade and settlements.

questions.question: Why is Harappan Civilization important for Indian history?
questions.answer: It represents the earliest urban culture in the region.

questions.question: Summarize the overall significance of the Harappan Civilization.
questions.answer: It laid the foundation of urban life, trade and culture in India.
